Issues.Title: Controls docked to bottom of SplitContainer within another SplitContainer slowly shift off bottom of panel.
Issues.Body:
### Environment

Microsoft Visual Studio Community 2022 (64-bit) - Current
Version 17.4.3


### .NET version

.NET Framework 4.6.1

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

Unknown.

### Issue description

If a horizontally split SplitContainer is placed inside another horizontally split SplitContainer and a control is anchored to the bottom when both SplitContainers have a SplitterWidth of 1, it will creep down when the form is saved in Designer mode, the designer is closed and then re-opened again. 

### Steps to reproduce

Add SplitContainer, set Orientation to Horizontal and splitterWidth to 1. Add a second SplitContainer to the top panel, set it's Orientation to Horizontal and splitterWidth to 1 as well. Add a label to the bottom panel of the second SplitContainer, Anchor it to the Bottom Right and place it in the very bottom right corner. Note the height. Save the form and open the code section. Close the designer section. Re-open the designer section and the label will have shifted down 3 pixels.
Note that it seems to be okay if the second Splitcontainer's SplitterWidth is set to 4 or higher.

### Diagnostics

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Controls docked to bottom of SplitContainer within another SplitContainer slowly shift off bottom of panel." (#11507)

Issues.Title: Anchoring issue on multi-monitor setup using HDPI PerMonitorV2
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 9.0 Preview 4

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

This worked in NET 6.

### Issue description

When moving the MDIParent from a 100% monitor to a 150% monitor, widening the form, closing frmNameList, then opening a new form (File -> Names), the new form is not laid out correctly.  The PictureBox Custom Control is too far to the left, but was anchored Top, Right.   The ListView control is too wide and overlaps with the controls to the right of it.

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/2184698/a41be26a-ba6f-48a2-b452-d78005e1631f

### Steps to reproduce

1. Run the project on a 100% monitor.
2. Move the MDIParent to a 150% monitor.
3. Make MDIParent wider
4. Close frmNameList then re-open it under the menu option File -> Name.
5. On the new form, the PictureBox Control is positioned too far to the left and inside the listview.  The regular PictureBox that is not a custom control is positioned properly.
6. The ListView control is too wide and overlaps with all of the controls to the right of it.

[AnchorIssue.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/15779847/AnchorIssue.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Anchoring issue on multi-monitor setup using HDPI PerMonitorV2" (#11516)

Issues.Title: Add WinForms Analyzer and CodeFixes Infrastructure for C# and Visual Basic
Issues.Body:
This PR introduces/extends the WinForms Analyzer infrastructure for C# and Visual Basic.
We will be introducing for .NET 9 a first set of Analyzers and Code Fixes, specifically for WinForms applications. The Analyzers will help developers to identify common issues in their WinForms applications and the Code Fixes will help to automatically fix these issues.

The PR includes the following changes:

* Refactor existing Analyzers in preparation to add VB Projects both for Analyzers and Code Fixes.
* Introduce Analyzers/CodeFixes for missing CodeDOM serialization configuration both for C# and VB.
* Bump up Roslyn/Analyzer NuGet package versions.
* Fix formatting in resource files and inconsistencies in unshipped files.
* Setup remaining analyzer projects.
* Finalize analyzer configuration.

THIS PR IS DRAFT AND NOT YET READY FOR REVIEW.

 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/11515)

Issues.Title: Opening Dialog Form on multi-monitor setup using HDPI PerMonitorV2 does not scale properly
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 9 Preview 4

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

This worked in .NET 6.0

### Issue description

Opening a modal Dialog form on a 150% monitor does not scale properly and the buttons anchored to the bottom right do not anchor properly.  They are rendered underneath controls above them and are unusable.

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/2184698/b60b5e9f-778c-49f2-96de-621a332c31a0

### Steps to reproduce

1. Open the project on a 100% monitor.
2. Click on Edit Non-Modal and Edit Modal.  Both forms scale properly and are the same size.
3. Move the MDIParent to a 150% monitor. 
4. Click on Edit Non-Modal and the form looks OK, but the buttons overlap slightly with the controls above them.
5. Click on Edit Modal and the buttons are higher and completely under other controls making them unusable.  The form itself is also larger than the Non-Modal version.

Here is a sample project:
[DialogIssue.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/15745870/DialogIssue.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Opening Dialog Form on multi-monitor setup using HDPI PerMonitorV2 does not scale properly" (#11512)

https://aka.ms/dotnet/download

### Did it work in .NET Framework? No ### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+? Does not work in net6 and net8. Not tested in other net core versions. ### Issue description I have a `PropertyGrid` with a custom modal `UITypeEditor`. In this editor I use `MessageBox` with a help button. ```c# MessageBox.Show( "Click Help. You will get 2 browsers opened (instead 1 as expected).", "MessageBox", MessageBoxButtons.OK, MessageBoxIcon.Information, MessageBoxDefaultButton.Button1, 0, "https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/"); ``` When I click the Help button, I got **two** tabs with a help link opened. ### Steps to reproduce * run the project attached [MsgBoxHelpProblem.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/15742690/MsgBoxHelpProblem.zip) * click the `[...]` button in the `PropertyGrid` in the `TestProp` row to run custom `UITypeEditor` * click the "Click me" button in editor * click the Help button in the `MessageBox` Expected: the single browser/tab opened with the help link Actual: *two* tabs with the help link opened. ### Additional notes: (Added later): the problem is not related to the `UITypeEditor`, it is related to the any modal windows, so the `nested editor` below may be replaced by the `nested modal dialogs/Form.ShowDialog() calls`. If we will add the nested editor (e.g. put another `PropertyGrid` in the `CustomForm`) and call the custom editor from this grid, then we will get the **3** tabs with a help link. So, it looks like each occurrence of the `IWindowsFormsEditorService.ShowDialog` on the stack will add the extra 1 unwanted help link tab.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Multiple help links opened, when clicking the Help button in the MessageBox within modal form" (#11510)
